Package com.karandev.util.net

Class TCP

java.lang.Object
com.karandev.util.net.TCP
public class TCP extends Object
Immutable TCP class for TCP socket operations

Copyleft (c) 1993 by C and System Programmers Association (CSD) All Rights Free

Author:
JavaApp2-Jan-2024 Group

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    TCP(Socket socket)
    Constructor to initialize a TCP instance with a provided socket.
    TCP(Socket socket, int timeout)
    Constructor to initialize a TCP instance with a provided socket and set a socket timeout.

  • Constructor Details

    • TCP

      public TCP(Socket socket)

      Constructor to initialize a TCP instance with a provided socket.

      Parameters:
      socket - the Socket instance to be used for TCP communication

    • TCP

      public TCP(Socket socket, int timeout)

      Constructor to initialize a TCP instance with a provided socket and set a socket timeout.

      Parameters:
      socket - the Socket instance to be used for TCP communication
      timeout - the timeout duration in milliseconds for socket operations
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if an error occurs when setting the timeout

  • Method Details

    • isOpen

      public boolean isOpen()

      Checks if the socket is open and ready for communication.

      Returns:
      true if the socket is open, otherwise false

    • getSocket

      public Socket getSocket()

      Retrieves the underlying socket used by this TCP instance.

      Returns:
      the Socket used for communication

    • receive

      public int receive(byte[] data, int offset, int length)

      Receives data from the socket.

      Parameters:
      data - the buffer to store received data
      offset - the offset into the buffer to start storing data
      length - the maximum number of bytes to read
      Returns:
      the number of bytes actually read
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if an error occurs while receiving data
      See Also:
      • TcpUtil.receive(Socket, byte[], int, int)

    • receive

      public int receive(byte[] data)

      Receives data from the socket.

      Parameters:
      data - the buffer to store received data
      Returns:
      the number of bytes actually read
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if an error occurs while receiving data
      See Also:
      • TcpUtil.receive(Socket, byte[])

    • send

      public int send(byte[] data, int offset, int length)

      Sends data to the socket.

      Parameters:
      data - the data to send
      offset - the offset into the buffer to start sending from
      length - the number of bytes to send
      Returns:
      the number of bytes actually sent
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if an error occurs while sending data
      See Also:
      • TcpUtil.send(Socket, byte[], int, int)

    • receiveStringViaLength

      public String receiveStringViaLength()

      Receives a length-prefixed string from the socket using default charset StandardCharsets.UTF_8

      Sender must use matching sendStringViaLength(String) method for successful transfer.

      Returns:
      the string received
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if an error occurs while receiving data
      See Also:
      • TcpUtil.receiveStringViaLength(Socket)

    • receiveStringViaLength

      public String receiveStringViaLength(Charset charset)

      Receives a length-prefixed string from the socket using specified charset.

      Sender must use matching sendStringViaLength(String, Charset) method for successful transfer.

      Parameters:
      charset - the Charset to use for decoding the string
      Returns:
      the string received
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if an error occurs while receiving data
      See Also:
      • TcpUtil.receiveString(Socket, int, Charset)

    • receiveString

      public String receiveString(int length)

      Receives a string of a specified length using default charset StandardCharsets.UTF_8.

      Parameters:
      length - the number of characters to read
      Returns:
      the string received
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if an error occurs while receiving data
      See Also:
      • TcpUtil.receiveString(Socket, int)

    • receiveString

      public String receiveString(int length, Charset charset)

      Receives a string of a specified length, using a specified charset.

      Parameters:
      length - the number of characters to read
      charset - the Charset to use for decoding the string
      Returns:
      the string received
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if an error occurs while receiving data
      See Also:
      • TcpUtil.receiveString(Socket, int, Charset)

    • receiveLine

      public String receiveLine()

      Receives a line of text.

      Uses default charset StandardCharsets.UTF_8

      Returns:
      the line received
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if an error occurs while receiving data
      NullPointerException - if an unexpected null value is encountered
      NegativeArraySizeException - if an invalid size for data buffer is specified
      See Also:
      • TcpUtil.receiveLine(Socket)

    • receiveLine

      public String receiveLine(Charset charset)

      Receives a line of text using specified charset

      Parameters:
      charset - the Charset to use for decoding the string
      Returns:
      the line received
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if an error occurs while receiving data
      NullPointerException - if an unexpected null value is encountered
      NegativeArraySizeException - if an invalid size for data buffer is specified
      See Also:
      • TcpUtil.receiveLine(Socket, Charset)

    • receiveLine

      public String receiveLine(int blockSize)

      Receives a line of text with a specified blockSize.

      Parameters:
      blockSize - the number of bytes to read in each block
      Returns:
      the line received
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if an error occurs while receiving data
      NullPointerException - if an unexpected null value is encountered
      NegativeArraySizeException - if an invalid size for data buffer is specified
      See Also:
      • TcpUtil.receiveLine(Socket, int)

    • receiveLine

      public String receiveLine(Charset charset, int blockSize)

      Receives a line of text using a specified charset and blockSize

      Parameters:
      charset - the Charset to use for decoding the string
      blockSize - the number of bytes to read in each block
      Returns:
      the line received
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if an error occurs while receiving data
      NullPointerException - if an unexpected null value is encountered
      NegativeArraySizeException - if an invalid size for data buffer is specified
      See Also:
      • TcpUtil.receiveLine(Socket, Charset, int)

    • receiveFile

      public void receiveFile(File file)

      Receives a file from the socket and saves it to a specified file object's path.

      Parameters:

      Throws:
      NetworkException - if an error occurs while receiving the file
      See Also:

      charset - the Charset to use for encoding the string
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if an error occurs while sending data

    • sendFile

      public void sendFile(File file, int blockSize)

      Sends a file to the socket, with a specified blockSize.

      Parameters:
      file - the File to send
      blockSize - the size of blocks to send the file in
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if an error occurs while sending the file
      See Also:
      • TcpUtil.sendFile(Socket, File, int)

    • sendFile

      public void sendFile(String path, int blockSize)

      Sends a file at path to the socket, with a specified blockSize.

      Parameters:
      path - the path of the file to send
      blockSize - the size of blocks to send the file in
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if an error occurs while sending the file
      See Also:
      • TcpUtil.sendFile(Socket, String, int)
